Tad tā KUNGA eņģelis pavēlēja Gadam sacīt Dāvidam, lai Dāvids dotos un uztaisītu altāri tam KUNGAM jebusieša Ornana kuļamklonā.

21.en: 19And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spake in the name of the LORD.
21.lv: 19 Un Dāvids devās pie Gada vārdiem, ko viņš runāja tā KUNGA vārdā.

21.en: 20And Ornan turned back, and saw the angel; and his four sons with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
21.lv: 20 Un Ornans griezās atpakaļ un redzēja eņģeli; un viņa četri dēli līdz ar viņu paslēpās. Tad nu Ornans kūla kviešus.

21.en: 21And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshingfloor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
21.lv: 21 Un Dāvidam nākot pie Ornana, Ornans palūkojās un redzēja Dāvidu, un izgāja no kuļamklona, un noliecās pie Dāvida ar savu seju pie zemes.

21.en: 22Then David said to Ornan, Grant me the place of this threshingfloor, that I may build an altar therein unto the LORD: thou shalt grant it me for the full price: that the plague may be stayed from the people.
21.lv: 22 Tad Dāvids Ornanam sacīja, Dāvā man vietu no šī kuļamklona, lai es varu uzbūvēt tajā altāri tam KUNGAM: tev man to būs dāvāt par pilnu cenu: lai sērga var tikt apturēta no ļaudīm.

21.en: 23And Ornan said unto David, Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes: lo, I give thee the oxen also for burnt offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meat offering; I give it all.
21.lv: 23 Un Ornans Dāvidam sacīja, Ņem to sev, un lai mans kungs ķēniņš dara, kas ir labs viņa acīs: rau, es dodu tev arī vēršus dedzināmajiem ziedojumiem un kuļaminstrumentus malkai, un kviešus ēdamajam ziedojumam; es to visu dodu.

21.en: 24And king David said to Ornan, Nay; but I will verily buy it for the full price: for I will not take that which is thine for the LORD, nor offer burnt offerings without cost.
21.lv: 24 Un ķēniņš Dāvids Ornanam sacīja, Nē; bet es patiesi to pirkšu par pilnu cenu: jo es neņemšu to, kas ir tavs tam KUNGAM, ne ziedošu dedzināmos ziedojumus bez maksas.

21.en: 25So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
21.lv: 25 Tā Dāvids Ornanam par to vietu deva sešsimt seķeļu zelta pēc svara.

21.en: 26And David built there an altar unto the LORD, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and called upon the LORD; and he answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt offering.
21.lv: 26 Un Dāvids tur uzbūvēja altāri tam KUNGAM un ziedoja dedzināmos ziedojumus un miera ziedojumus, un sauca uz to KUNGU; un viņš tam atbildēja no debess ar uguni uz dedzināmā ziedojuma altāra.

21.en: 27And the LORD commanded the angel; and he put up his sword again into the sheath thereof.
21.lv: 27 Un tas KUNGS pavēlēja eņģelim; un viņš lika savu zobenu atpakaļ tā makstī.

21.en: 28At that time when David saw that the LORD had answered him in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
21.lv:
28

Tajā laikā, kad Dāvids redzēja, ka tas KUNGS viņam bija atbildējis jebusieša Ornana kuļamklonā, tad viņš tur upurēja.

21.en: 29For the tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of the burnt offering, were at that season in the high place at Gibeon.
21.lv: 29 Jo tā KUNGA mājoklis, ko Mozus taisīja tuksnesī, un dedzināmā ziedojuma altāris tajā laikā bija Gibeonas augstajā vietā.

21.en: 30But David could not go before it to enquire of God: for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of the LORD.
21.lv: 30 Bet Dāvids nevarēja iet tās priekšā, jautāt no Dieva: jo viņš baidījās tā KUNGA eņģeļa zobena dēļ.

22.en: 1Then David said, This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of the burnt offering for Israel.
22.lv: 1 Tad Dāvids sacīja, Šis ir tā KUNGA Dieva nams, un šis ir dedzināmā ziedojuma altāris priekš Israēla.

22.en: 2And David commanded to gather together the strangers that were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
22.lv: 2 Un Dāvids pavēlēja sapulcināt kopā svešiniekus, kas bija Israēla zemē; un viņš iecēla mūrniekus cirst kaltus akmeņus, lai būvētu Dieva namu.

22.en: 3And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the joinings; and brass in abundance without weight;
22.lv: 3 Un Dāvids sagatavoja dzelzi vārtu durvju naglām un savienojumiem pārpilnībā; un misiņu pārpilnībā bez svara;

22.en: 4Also cedar trees in abundance: for the Zidonians and they of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.
22.lv: 4 Arī ciedru kokus pārpilnībā: jo sidonieši un tie no Tiras Dāvidam veda daudz ciedra koku.

22.en: 5And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for the LORD must be exceeding magnifical, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore now make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.
22.lv: 5 Un Dāvids sacīja, Mans dēls Salamans ir jauns un maigs, un namam, kas tiks būvēts priekš tā KUNGA, jābūt ārkārtīgi greznam, par slavu un par godību pa visām zemēm: Tāpēc es nu sagatavoju priekš tā. Tā Dāvids pirms savas nāves pārpārēm sagatavoja.

22.en: 6Then he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build an house for the LORD God of Israel.
22.lv:
6

Tad viņš aicināja savu dēlu Salamanu un piekodināja tam būvēt namu priekš tā KUNGA, Israēla Dieva.

22.en: 7And David said to Solomon, My son, as for me, it was in my mind to build an house unto the name of the LORD my God:
22.lv: 7 Un Dāvids Salamanam sacīja, Mans dēls, kas attiecas uz mani, manā prātā bija uzbūvēt namu tā KUNGA, mana Dieva, vārdam:

22.en: 8But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars: thou shalt not build an house unto my name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.
22.lv: 8 Bet man nāca tā KUNGA vārds sacīdams, Tu esi pārpārēm izlējis asinis un esi karojis lielus karus: tev nebūs būvēt namu manam vārdam, tāpēc ka tu manā skatienā esi izlējis daudz asiņu uz zemes.

22.en: 9Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about: for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
22.lv: 9 Lūk, tev piedzims dēls, kurš būs dusas vīrietis; un es viņam došu dusu no visiem viņa ienaidniekiem visapkārt: jo viņa vārds būs Salamans, un es došu Israēlam mieru un klusumu viņa dienās.

22.en: 10He shall build an house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.
22.lv: 10 Viņš uzbūvēs namu manam vārdam; un viņš būs mans dēls, un es būšu viņa tēvs; un es nostiprināšu viņa valstības troni pār Israēlu mūžīgi.

22.en: 11Now, my son, the LORD be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the LORD thy God, as he hath said of thee.
22.lv: 11 Tad nu, mans dēls, tas KUNGS lai ir ar tevi; un sekmējies un uzbūvē tā KUNGA, sava Dieva, namu, kā viņš par tevi ir sacījis.

22.en: 12Only the LORD give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel, that thou mayest keep the law of the LORD thy God.
22.lv: 12 Tikai lai tas KUNGS tev dod gudrību un saprašanu, un dod tev pavēli attiecībā uz Israēlu, lai tu vari turēt tā KUNGA, sava Dieva, likumu.

22.en: 13Then shalt thou prosper, if thou takest heed to fulfil the statutes and judgments which the LORD charged Moses with concerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.
22.lv: 13 Tad tu sekmēsies, ja tu pielūko pildīt statūtus un tiesas, ko tas KUNGS piekodināja Mozum attiecībā uz Israēlu: esi stiprs un drosmīgs; nešausminies, ne tiec izbiedēts.

22.en: 14Now, behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the LORD an hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add thereto.
22.lv: 14 Tad nu, lūk, savās bēdās es tā KUNGA namam esmu sagatavojis simts tūkstošus talentu zelta un tūkstoš tūkstošus talentu sudraba; un no misiņa un dzelzs bez svara; jo tas ir pārpilnībā: es esmu sagatavojis arī kokmateriālus un akmeni; un tu tam vari pielikt.

22.en: 15Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of cunning men for every manner of work.
22.lv: 15 Turklāt pie tevis ir strādnieki pārpilnībā, cirtēji un akmens un kokmateriālu strādnieki, un visādi izveicīgi vīrieši ikviena veida darbam.

22.en: 16Of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise therefore, and be doing, and the LORD be with thee.
22.lv: 16 Zeltam, sudrabam un misiņam, un dzelzij nav skaita. Tāpēc celies un dari, un tas KUNGS lai ir ar tevi.

22.en: 17David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
22.lv: 17 Dāvids arī pavēlēja visiem Israēla prinčiem palīdzēt viņa dēlam Salamanam sacīdams,

22.en: 18Is not the LORD your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath given the inhabitants of the land into mine hand; and the land is subdued before the LORD, and before his people.
22.lv: 18 Vai tas KUNGS, jūsu Dievs, nav ar jums? un vai viņš nav jums devis dusu no visām pusēm? jo viņš manā rokā ir devis tās zemes iedzīvotājus; un tā zeme ir pakļauta tā KUNGA priekšā un viņa ļaužu priekšā.

22.en: 19Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God; arise therefore, and build ye the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the name of the LORD.
22.lv: 19 Tad nu lieciet savu sirdi un dvēseli meklēt to KUNGU, savu Dievu; tāpēc celieties un uzbūvējiet tā KUNGA Dieva svētnīcu, ienest tā KUNGA derības šķirstu un Dieva svētos traukus namā, kas tiks būvēts tā KUNGA vārdam.

23.en: 1So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
23.lv: 1 Tā, kad Dāvids bija vecs un pilns dienu, viņš savu dēlu Salamanu iecēla par ķēniņu pār Israēlu.

23.en: 2And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
23.lv:
2

Un viņš sapulcēja kopā visus Israēla prinčus ar priesteriem un levītiem.

23.en: 3Now the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand.
23.lv: 3 Tad nu levīti tika skaitīti no trīsdesmit gadu vecuma un uz augšu: un viņu skaits pēc viņu galvām, vīrietis pēc vīrieša, bija trīsdesmit astoņi tūkstoši.

23.en: 4Of which, twenty and four thousand were to set forward the work of the house of the LORD; and six thousand were officers and judges:
23.lv: 4 No kuriem divdesmit četri tūkstoši bija jāizvirza uz tā Kunga nama darbu; un seši tūkstoši bija virsnieki un tiesneši:

23.en: 5Moreover four thousand were porters; and four thousand praised the LORD with the instruments which I made, said David, to praise therewith.
23.lv: 5 Turklāt četri tūkstoši bija durvju sargi; un četri tūkstoši slavēja to KUNGU ar instrumentiem, ko es taisīju, sacīja Dāvids, lai ar tiem slavētu.

23.en: 6And David divided them into courses among the sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
23.lv: 6 Un Dāvids tos sadalīja kārtās starp Levija dēliem, proti, Geršonu, Kohātu un Merari.

23.en: 7Of the Gershonites were, Laadan, and Shimei.
23.lv:
7

No gersoniešiem bija Lādans un Šimejs.

23.en: 8The sons of Laadan; the chief was Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
23.lv: 8 Lādana dēli; galvenais bija Jehiels, un Zetams, un Joels, trīs.

23.en: 9The sons of Shimei; Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the chief of the fathers of Laadan.
23.lv: 9 Šimeja dēli; Šelomits un Haziels, un Harans, trīs. Šie bija Lādana tēvu galvenie.

23.en: 10And the sons of Shimei were, Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
23.lv: 10 Un Šimeja dēli bija Jahats, Cina un Jeušs, un Berija. Šie četri bija Šimeja dēli.

23.en: 11And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they were in one reckoning, according to their father's house.
23.lv: 11 Un Jahats bija galvenais, un Ciza otrais: bet Jeušam un Berijai nebija daudz dēlu; tāpēc viņi bija vienā uzskaitīšanā atbilstoši viņu tēva namam.

23.en: 12The sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
23.lv:
12

Kohāta dēli; Amrams, Izārs, Hebrons un Uciels, četri.

23.en: 13The sons of Amram; Aaron and Moses: and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons for ever, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister unto him, and to bless in his name for ever.
23.lv: 13 Amrama dēli; Ārons un Mozus, un Ārons tika nošķirts, lai viņš svētdarītu vissvētākās lietas, viņš un viņa dēli mūžīgi, dedzināt kvēpināmo tā KUNGA priekšā, kalpot viņam un svētīt viņa vārdā mūžīgi.

23.en: 14Now concerning Moses the man of God, his sons were named of the tribe of Levi.
23.lv: 14 Tad nu attiecībā uz Mozu, Dieva vīrieti, viņa dēli tika nosaukti no Levija cilts.

23.en: 15The sons of Moses were, Gershom, and Eliezer.
23.lv: 15 Un Mozus dēli bija Geršoms un Eliezers.

23.en: 16Of the sons of Gershom, Shebuel was the chief.
23.lv: 16 No Geršoma dēliem Šebuēls bija galvenais.

23.en: 17And the sons of Eliezer were, Rehabiah the chief. And Eliezer had none other sons; but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
23.lv: 17 Un Eliezera dēli bija Rehabija, galvenais. Un Eliezeram nebija citu dēlu; bet Rehabija dēlu bija ļoti daudz.

23.en: 18Of the sons of Izhar; Shelomith the chief.
23.lv: 18 No Ičara dēliem; Šelomits galvenais.

23.en: 19Of the sons of Hebron; Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
23.lv: 19 No Hebrona dēliem; Jerija pirmais, Amarija otrais, Jahaziēls trešais un Jekameams ceturtais.

23.en: 20Of the sons of Uzziel; Michah the first, and Jesiah the second.
23.lv: 20 No Uciela dēliem; Miha pirmais un Jesija otrais.

23.en: 21The sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. The sons of Mahli; Eleazar, and Kish.
23.lv:
21

Merari dēli; Mahli un Muši. Mahli dēli; Eleazars un Kišs.

23.en: 22And Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters: and their brethren the sons of Kish took them.
23.lv: 22 Un Eleazars nomira, un [viņam] nebija dēlu, tikai meitas: un viņu brāļi, Kiša dēli, tās ņēma.

23.en: 23The sons of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
23.lv: 23 Muši dēli; Mahli un Eders, un Jeremots, trīs.

23.en: 24These were the sons of Levi after the house of their fathers; even the chief of the fathers, as they were counted by number of names by their polls, that did the work for the service of the house of the LORD, from the age of twenty years and upward.
23.lv:
24

Šie bija Levija dēli pēc savu tēvu nama; proti, tēvu galvenie, kā tie tika skaitīti pēc vārdu skaita pēc viņu galvām, kas darīja darbu tā KUNGA nama kalpošanai, no divdesmit gadiem un uz augšu.

23.en: 25For David said, The LORD God of Israel hath given rest unto his people, that they may dwell in Jerusalem for ever:
23.lv: 25 Jo Dāvids sacīja, Tas KUNGS, Israēla Dievs, ir devis dusu saviem ļaudīm, lai tie var mājot Jeruzālemē mūžīgi:

23.en: 26And also unto the Levites; they shall no more carry the tabernacle, nor any vessels of it for the service thereof.
23.lv: 26 Un arī levītiem; tie vairs nenesīs mājokli, ne kādus tā traukus priekš tā kalpošanas.

23.en: 27For by the last words of David the Levites were numbered from twenty years old and above:
23.lv: 27 Jo pēc pēdējiem Dāvida vārdiem levīti tika saskaitīti, no divdesmit gadiem un uz augšu:

23.en: 28Because their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the LORD, in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God;
23.lv: 28 Tāpēc ka viņu amats bija apkalpot Ārona dēlus tā KUNGA nama kalpošanai, pagalmos un kambaros un visu svēto lietu šķīstīšanā un Dieva nama kalpošanas darbā;

23.en: 29Both for the shewbread, and for the fine flour for meat offering, and for the unleavened cakes, and for that which is baked in the pan, and for that which is fried, and for all manner of measure and size;
23.lv: 29 Gan priekšā liekamajai maizei, gan smalkajiem miltiem ēdiena ziedojumam, gan neraudzētajiem plāceņiem, gan tam, kas tiek cepts pannā, gan tam, kas tiek fritēts, gan visa veida mēram un izmēram;

23.en: 30And to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD, and likewise at even;
23.lv: 30 Un stāvēt ik rītu pateikties un slavēt to KUNGU, un tāpat vakarā;

23.en: 31And to offer all burnt sacrifices unto the LORD in the sabbaths, in the new moons, and on the set feasts, by number, according to the order commanded unto them, continually before the LORD:
23.lv: 31 Un ziedot tam KUNGAM visus dedzināmos ziedojumus sabatos, jaunajos mēnešos un noteiktajos svētkos, atbilstoši tiem pavēlētajā secībā, pastāvīgi tā KUNGA priekšā:

23.en: 32And that they should keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the charge of the holy place, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brethren, in the service of the house of the LORD.
23.lv: 32 Un lai viņiem ir pārziņa par sanāksmes mājokli un svēto vietu, un viņu brāļu, Ārona dēlu, pārziņa, tā KUNGA nama kalpošanā.

24.en: 1Now these are the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron; Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
24.lv: 1 Tad nu šie ir Ārona dēlu iedalījumi. Ārona dēli; Nadabs un Abihus, Eleāzars un Itamars.

24.en: 2But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest's office.
24.lv: 2 Bet Nadabs un Abihus nomira pirms sava tēva, un [viņiem] nebija bērnu: tāpēc Eleāzars un Itamars izpildīja priestera amatu.

24.en: 3And David distributed them, both Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, according to their offices in their service.
24.lv: 3 Un Dāvids tos izdalīja gan Cadoku no Eleazara dēliem, gan Ahimelehu no Itamara dēliem atbilstoši viņu amatiem viņu kalpošanā.

24.en: 4And there were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar; and thus were they divided. Among the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen chief men of the house of their fathers, and eight among the sons of Ithamar according to the house of their fathers.
24.lv: 4 Un no Eleazara dēliem tika atrasts vairāk galveno nekā no Itamara dēliem; un tā viņi tika sadalīti. Starp Eleazara dēliem bija sešpadsmit viņu tēvu nama galveno un astoņi starp Itamara dēliem atbilstoši viņu tēvu namam.

24.en: 5Thus were they divided by lot, one sort with another; for the governors of the sanctuary, and governors of the house of God, were of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.
24.lv: 5 Tā viņi tika sadalīti caur mesliem, viens veids ar otru; jo svētnīcas pārvaldnieki un Dieva nama pārvaldnieki bija no Eleazara dēliem un no Itamara dēliem.

24.en: 6And Shemaiah the son of Nethaneel the scribe, one of the Levites, wrote them before the king, and the princes, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and before the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites: one principal household being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.
24.lv: 6 Un Šemaja, Netanēla dēls, rakstvedis, viens no levītiem, tos uzrakstīja ķēniņa un prinču, un priestera Cadoka, un Ahimeleha, Abjatara dēla, un priesteru, un levītu tēvu galveno priekšā: viena galvenā saime tika ņemta par Eleazaru, un viena ņemta par Itamaru.

24.en: 7Now the first lot came forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
24.lv: 7 Tad nu pirmie mesli iznāca Jeojaribam, otrie Jedajam,

24.en: 8The third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
24.lv: 8 Trešie Harim, ceturtie Seorimam,

24.en: 9The fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
24.lv: 9 Piektie Malkijam, sestie Mijaminam,

24.en: 10The seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
24.lv: 10 Septītie Hakozam, astotie Abijam,

24.en: 11The ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
24.lv: 11 Devītie Ješuam, desmitie Šekanijam,

24.en: 12The eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
24.lv: 12 Vienpadsmitie Eljašibam, divpadsmitie Jakimam,

24.en: 13The thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
24.lv: 13 Trīspadsmitie Hupam, četrpadsmitie Ješebeābam,

24.en: 14The fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
24.lv: 14 Piecpadsmitie Bilgam, sešpadsmitie Immeram,

24.en: 15The seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Aphses,
24.lv: 15 Septiņpadsmitie Heziram, astoņpadsmitie Afsesam,

24.en: 16The nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel,
24.lv: 16 Deviņpadsmitie Petahijam, divdesmitie Jehezekelam,

24.en: 17The one and twentieth to Jachin, the two and twentieth to Gamul,
24.lv: 17 Divdesmitais pirmie Jahinam, divdesmit otrie Gamulam,

24.en: 18The three and twentieth to Delaiah, the four and twentieth to Maaziah.
24.lv: 18 Divdesmitā trešie Delaijam, divdesmit ceturtie Maacijam.

24.en: 19These were the orderings of them in their service to come into the house of the LORD, according to their manner, under Aaron their father, as the LORD God of Israel had commanded him.
24.lv: 19 Šīs bija viņu secības viņu kalpošanā, nākt tā KUNGA namā atbilstoši viņu ieražai, zem sava tēva Ārona, kā tas KUNGS, Israēla Dievs, bija viņam pavēlējis.

24.en: 20And the rest of the sons of Levi were these: Of the sons of Amram; Shubael: of the sons of Shubael; Jehdeiah.
24.lv:
20

Un pārējie no Levija dēliem bija šie: No Amrama dēliem; Šubaels: no Šubaela dēliem; Jehdeja.

24.en: 21Concerning Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, the first was Isshiah.
24.lv: 21 Kas attiecas uz Rehabiju: no Rehabijas dēliem pirmais bija Išija.

24.en: 22Of the Izharites; Shelomoth: of the sons of Shelomoth; Jahath.
24.lv: 22 No ihariešiem; Šelomots: no Šelomata dēliem; Jahats.

24.en: 23And the sons of Hebron; Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
24.lv: 23 Un Hebrona dēli; Jērija pirmais, Amarija otrais, Jahaziels trešais, Jekameams ceturtais.

24.en: 24Of the sons of Uzziel; Michah: of the sons of Michah; Shamir.
24.lv: 24 No Uciela dēliem; Miha: no Mihas dēliem; Šamirs.

24.en: 25The brother of Michah was Isshiah: of the sons of Isshiah; Zechariah.
24.lv: 25 Mihas brālis bija Išija, no Išija dēliem; Caharija.

24.en: 26The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi: the sons of Jaaziah; Beno.
24.lv: 26 Merari dēli bija Mahli un Muši: Jazijas dēli; Beno.

24.en: 27The sons of Merari by Jaaziah; Beno, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Ibri.
24.lv:
27

Merari dēli no Jaācijas; Beno, un Šohams, un Zakurs, un Ibri.

24.en: 28Of Mahli came Eleazar, who had no sons.
24.lv: 28 No Mahli nāca Eleazars, kuram nebija dēlu.

24.en: 29Concerning Kish: the son of Kish was Jerahmeel.
24.lv: 29 Kas attiecas uz Kišu: Kiša dēls bija Jerameēls.

24.en: 30The sons also of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after the house of their fathers.
24.lv: 30 Arī Muši dēli; Mahli, un Eders, un Jerimots. Šie bija levītu dēli pēc viņu tēvu nama.

24.en: 31These likewise cast lots over against their brethren the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites, even the principal fathers over against their younger brethren.
24.lv: 31 Tāpat arī šie meta meslus iepretī saviem brāļiem, Ārona dēliem, ķēniņa Dāvida un Cadoka, un Ahimeleha, un priesteru, un levītu tēvu galveno, proti, galveno tēvu klātbūtnē, iepretī saviem jaunākajiem brāļiem.

25.en: 1Moreover David and the captains of the host separated to the service of the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals: and the number of the workmen according to their service was:
25.lv: 1 Turklāt Dāvids un karapulku kapteiņi atšķīra Asafa un Hemana, un Jedutuna dēlus kalpošanai, kuri pravietotu ar arfām, ar psalterijiem un ar šķīvjiem: un strādnieku skaits atbilstoši viņu kalpošanai bija:

25.en: 2Of the sons of Asaph; Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asarelah, the sons of Asaph under the hands of Asaph, which prophesied according to the order of the king.
25.lv: 2 No Asafa dēliem; Zakurs un Jāzeps, un Netanja, un Asarelahs, Asafa dēli zem Asafa rokas, kas pravietoja atbilstoši ķēniņa kārtībai.

25.en: 3Of Jeduthun: the sons of Jeduthun; Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with a harp, to give thanks and to praise the LORD.
25.lv: 3 No Jedutana: Jedutana dēli; Gedalija un Ceri, un Jeshanija, Hašabija, un Matitija, seši, zem sava tēva Jedutana rokas, kas pravietoja ar arfu, pateikties un slavēt to KUNGU.

25.en: 4Of Heman: the sons of Heman; Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamtiezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth:
25.lv: 4 No Hemana: Hemana dēli; Bukija, Matanja, Uciēls, Šebuēls un Jerimots, Hananja, Hanani, Eliata, Giddalti, un Romamtiecers, Jošbekaša, Maloti, Hotirs, Mahazots:

25.en: 5All these were the sons of Heman the king's seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
25.lv: 5 Visi šie bija ķēniņa gaišreģa Hemaņa dēli Dieva vārdos, pacelt ragu. Un Dievs Hemanam deva četrpadsmit dēlus un trīs meitas.

25.en: 6All these were under the hands of their father for song in the house of the LORD, with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, for the service of the house of God, according to the king's order to Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman.
25.lv: 6 Šie visi bija zem sava tēva rokām priekš dziesmas tā KUNGA namā ar šķīvjiem, psalterijiem un arfām, priekš Dieva nama kalpošanas atbilstoši ķēniņa kārtībai Asafam, Jedutunam un Hemanam.

25.en: 7So the number of them, with their brethren that were instructed in the songs of the LORD, even all that were cunning, was two hundred fourscore and eight.
25.lv: 7 Tā viņu skaits kopā ar viņu brāļiem, kas bija apmācīti tā KUNGA dziesmās, proti, visi, kas bija izveicīgi, bija divi simti astoņdesmit astoņi.

25.en: 8And they cast lots, ward against ward, as well the small as the great, the teacher as the scholar.
25.lv: 8 Un viņi meta meslus, sardze pret sardzi, gan mazais, gan lielais, kā skolotājs, tā skolnieks.

25.en: 9Now the first lot came forth for Asaph to Joseph: the second to Gedaliah, who with his brethren and sons were twelve:
25.lv: 9 Tad nu pirmie mesli par Asafu iznāca Jāzepam: otrie Gedaljam, kuri kopā ar saviem brāļiem un dēliem bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 10The third to Zaccur, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 10 Trešie Zakuram, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 11The fourth to Izri, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 11 Ceturtie Izrimam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 12The fifth to Nethaniah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 12 Piektie bija Netanijam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 13The sixth to Bukkiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 13 Sestie Bukijam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 14The seventh to Jesharelah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 14 Septītie Ješarelam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 15The eighth to Jeshaiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 15 Astotie Ješajam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 16The ninth to Mattaniah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 16 Devītie Matanijam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 17The tenth to Shimei, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 17 Desmitie Šimim, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 18The eleventh to Azareel, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 18 Vienpadsmitie Azareelam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 19The twelfth to Hashabiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 19 Divpadsmitie Hašabjam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 20The thirteenth to Shubael, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 20 Trīspadsmitie Šubaelam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 21The fourteenth to Mattithiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 21 Četrpadsmitie Matitijam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 22The fifteenth to Jeremoth, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 22 Piecpadsmitie Jeremotam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 23The sixteenth to Hananiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 23 Sešpadsmitie Hananijam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 24The seventeenth to Joshbekashah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 24 Septiņpadsmitie Jošbekašam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 25The eighteenth to Hanani, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 25 Astoņpadsmitie Hanani, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 26The nineteenth to Mallothi, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 26 Deviņpadsmitie Maloti, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 27The twentieth to Eliathah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 27 Divdesmitie Eliatam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 28The one and twentieth to Hothir, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 28 Divdesmit pirmie Hotiram, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 29The two and twentieth to Giddalti, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 29 Divdesmit otrie Giddalti, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 30The three and twentieth to Mahazioth, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
25.lv: 30 Divdesmit trešie Mahaziotam, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit:

25.en: 31The four and twentieth to Romamtiezer, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve.
25.lv: 31 Divdesmit ceturtie Romamtiezeram, viņš, viņa dēli un viņa brāļi, bija divpadsmit.

26.en: 1Concerning the divisions of the porters: Of the Korhites was Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
26.lv: 1 Kas attiecas uz durvju sargu iedalījumiem: No korhiešiem bija Mešelemija, Kores dēls, no Asafa dēliem.

26.en: 2And the sons of Meshelemiah were, Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
26.lv: 2 Un Mešelemijas dēli bija Caharija, pirmdzimtais, Jediaels, otrais, Zebadja, trešais, Jatniels, ceturtais,

26.en: 3Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Elioenai the seventh.
26.lv: 3 Elams piektais, Jeohanans sestais, Elioenai septītais.

26.en: 4Moreover the sons of Obededom were, Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethaneel the fifth,
26.lv: 4 Turklāt Obededoma dēli bija Šemaja, pirmdzimtais, Jeozabads otrais, Joahs trešais, Sakars ceturtais un Netanēls piektais,

26.en: 5Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth: for God blessed him.
26.lv: 5 Ammiēls sestais, Isahars septītais, Peulthajs astotais; jo Dievs viņu svētīja.

26.en: 6Also unto Shemaiah his son were sons born, that ruled throughout the house of their father: for they were mighty men of valour.
26.lv: 6 Arī viņa dēlam Šemajam piedzima dēli, kas valdīja visā sava tēva namā: jo tie bija vareni, drosmīgi vīrieši.

26.en: 7The sons of Shemaiah; Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad, whose brethren were strong men, Elihu, and Semachiah.
26.lv: 7 Šemajas dēli; Otni un Refaēls, un Obeds, Elzabads, kuru brāļi bija stipri vīrieši, Elihu un Semahija.

26.en: 8All these of the sons of Obededom: they and their sons and their brethren, able men for strength for the service, were threescore and two of Obededom.
26.lv: 8 Visi šie no Obededoma dēliem: viņi un viņu dēli, un viņu brāļi, spējīgi vīrieši stiprumam priekš kalpošanas, bija sešdesmit divi no Obededoma.

26.en: 9And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, strong men, eighteen.
26.lv: 9 Un Meselemijam bija dēli un brāļi, stiprinieki, astoņpadsmit.

26.en: 10Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons; Simri the chief, (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him the chief;)
26.lv: 10 Arī Hosam, no Merari bērniem, bija dēli; Simri, galvenais (jo, kaut arī viņš nebija pirmdzimtais, tomēr viņa tēvs viņu darīja par galveno;)

26.en: 11Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
26.lv: 11 Otrais Hilkija, trešais Tebalja, ceturtais Caharja: visi Hosas dēli un brāļi bija trīspadsmit.

26.en: 12Among these were the divisions of the porters, even among the chief men, having wards one against another, to minister in the house of the LORD.
26.lv: 12 Starp šiem bija durvju sargu nodaļas, proti, starp galvenajiem ar sardzēm vienai pret otru, lai kalpotu tā KUNGA namā.

26.en: 13And they cast lots, as well the small as the great, according to the house of their fathers, for every gate.
26.lv: 13 Un viņi meta meslus, kā mazie, tā lielie, atbilstoši savu tēvu namam par ikvieniem vārtiem.

26.en: 14And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counsellor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
26.lv: 14 Un mesli uz austrumiem krita Selemijam. Tad viņa dēlam Caharijam, gudram padomdevējam, viņi meta meslus; un viņa mesli iznāca uz ziemeļiem.

26.en: 15To Obededom southward; and to his sons the house of Asuppim.
26.lv: 15 Obededomam uz dienvidiem; un viņa dēliem Asuppima nams.

26.en: 16To Shuppim and Hosah the lot came forth westward, with the gate Shallecheth, by the causeway of the going up, ward against ward.
26.lv: 16 Šupimam un Hosam mesli iznāca uz rietumiem, ar Šalhetas vārtiem, pa uziešanas uzbērtu ceļu, sardzei pret sardzi.

26.en: 17Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and toward Asuppim two and two.
26.lv: 17 Uz austrumiem bija seši levīti, uz ziemeļiem četri dienā, uz dienvidiem četri dienā un uz Asuppimu divi un divi.

26.en: 18At Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.
26.lv: 18 Pie Parbaras uz rietumiem, četri pie uzbērta ceļa un divi pie Parbaras.

26.en: 19These are the divisions of the porters among the sons of Kore, and among the sons of Merari.
26.lv: 19 Šīs ir durvju sargu iedalījumi starp Kores dēliem un starp Merari dēliem.

26.en: 20And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated things.
26.lv:
20

Un no levītiem Ahija bija pār Dieva nama dārgumiem un pār veltīto lietu dārgumiem.

26.en: 21As concerning the sons of Laadan; the sons of the Gershonite Laadan, chief fathers, even of Laadan the Gershonite, were Jehieli.
26.lv: 21 Kas attiecas uz Lādana dēliem; geršonieša Lādana dēli, galvenie tēvi, proti, no geršonieša Lādana, bija Jehieli.

26.en: 22The sons of Jehieli; Zetham, and Joel his brother, which were over the treasures of the house of the LORD.
26.lv: 22 Jehieli dēli; Zetams un viņa brālis Joels, kas bija pār tā KUNGA nama dārgumiem.

26.en: 23Of the Amramites, and the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
26.lv: 23 No amramiešiem un ihariešiem, hebroniešiem, uzieliešiem:

26.en: 24And Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasures.
26.lv: 24 Un Šebuels, Geršoma, Mozus dēla, dēls, bija dārgumu valdnieks.

26.en: 25And his brethren by Eliezer; Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
26.lv: 25 Un viņa brāļi pie Eliezera; viņa dēls Rehabija un viņa dēls Ješaja, un viņa dēls Jorams, un viņa dēls Zihri, un viņa dēls Šelomits.

26.en: 26Which Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasures of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the chief fathers, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the host, had dedicated.
26.lv: 26 Tas Šelomits un viņa brāļi bija pār visiem veltīto lietu dārgumiem, ko ķēniņš Dāvids un galvenie tēvi, kapteiņi pār tūkstošiem un simtiem, un karapulku kapteiņi bija veltījuši.

26.en: 27Out of the spoils won in battles did they dedicate to maintain the house of the LORD.
26.lv: 27 No kaujās iegūtā laupījuma viņi veltīja tā KUNGA nama uzturēšanai.

26.en: 28And all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, had dedicated; and whosoever had dedicated any thing, it was under the hand of Shelomith, and of his brethren.
26.lv: 28 Un visu, ko gaišreģis Samuēls, un Sauls, Kiša dēls, un Abners, Nera dēls, un Joābs, Cerujas dēls, bija veltījuši; un kurš vien kaut ko bija veltījis, tas bija zem Šelomita un viņa brāļu rokas.

26.en: 29Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.
26.lv: 29 No izhariešiem Kenanja un viņa dēli bija Israēla ārējai darbībai, par virsniekiem un tiesnešiem.

26.en: 30And of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of valour, a thousand and seven hundred, were officers among them of Israel on this side Jordan westward in all the business of the LORD, and in the service of the king.
26.lv: 30 Un no hebroniešiem Hašabja un viņa brāļi, drosmīgi vīrieši, tūkstotis septiņi simti, bija virsnieki starp tiem no Israēla šajā Jordānas pusē uz rietumiem visās tā KUNGA lietās un ķēniņa kalpošanā.

26.en: 31Among the Hebronites was Jerijah the chief, even among the Hebronites, according to the generations of his fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valour at Jazer of Gilead.
26.lv: 31 Starp hebroniešiem Jerija bija galvenais, proti, starp hebroniešiem, atbilstoši viņa tēvu paaudzēm. Četrdesmitajā Dāvida valdīšanas gadā viņus meklēja, un starp tiem tika atrasti vareni drosmīgi vīrieši Gileādas Jazerā.

26.en: 32And his brethren, men of valour, were two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers, whom king David made rulers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God, and affairs of the king.
26.lv: 32 Un viņa brāļi, drosmīgi vīrieši, bija divi tūkstoši septiņi simti galveno tēvu, kurus ķēniņš Dāvids iecēla par valdniekiem pār rūbeniešiem, gadiešiem un Manases puscilti priekš ikvienas lietas, kas attiecas uz Dievu, un ķēniņa lietām.

27.en: 1Now the children of Israel after their number, to wit, the chief fathers and captains of thousands and hundreds, and their officers that served the king in any matter of the courses, which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, of every course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 1 Tad nu Israēla bērni pēc viņu skaita, proti, galvenie tēvi un tūkstošu un simtu kapteiņi, un viņu virsnieki, kas kalpoja ķēniņam visās kārtas lietās, kas katru mēnesi ienāca un izgāja visu gada mēnešu laikā, no ikvienas kārtas bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 2Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 2 Pār pirmo kārtu pirmajam mēnesim bija Jašobeems, Zabdiēla dēls: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 3Of the children of Perez was the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.
27.lv: 3 No Pereca bērniem bija visu karapulka kapteiņu galvenais pirmajam mēnesim.

27.en: 4And over the course of the second month was Dodai an Ahohite, and of his course was Mikloth also the ruler: in his course likewise were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 4 Un pār otrā mēneša kārtu bija ahoietis Dodajs, un no viņa kārtas Miklots arī bija valdnieks: viņa kārtā tāpat bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 5The third captain of the host for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, a chief priest: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 5 Trešais karapulka kapteinis trešajam mēnesim bija Benaja, Jeojadas dēls, virspriesteris: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 6This is that Benaiah, who was mighty among the thirty, and above the thirty: and in his course was Ammizabad his son.
27.lv: 6 Šis ir tas Benaja, kurš bija varens starp tiem trīsdesmit un pāri tiem trīsdesmit: un viņa kārtā bija viņa dēls Amizabads.

27.en: 7The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 7 Ceturtais kapteinis ceturtajam mēnesim bija Asahels, Joāba brālis, un pēc viņa viņa dēls Zebadja: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 8The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 8 Piektais kapteinis piektajam mēnesim bija ičrahietis Šamhuts: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 9The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 9 Sestais kapteinis sestajam mēnesim bija Ira, tekoieša Ikeša dēls: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 10The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 10 Septītais kapteinis septītajam mēnesim bija pelonietis Helecs, no Efraima bērniem: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 11The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zarhites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 11 Astotais kapteinis astotajam mēnesim bija hušatietis Sibekajs no zarhiešiem: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 12The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anetothite, of the Benjamites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 12 Devītais kapteinis devītajam mēnesim bija anetotietis Abiezers no benjamīniešiem: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 13The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 13 Desmitais kapteinis desmitajam mēnesim bija netofatietis Maharajs no zarhiešiem: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 14The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 14 Vienpadsmitais kapteinis vienpadsmitajam mēnesim bija piratonietis Benaja, no Efraima bērniem: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 15The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
27.lv: 15 Divpadsmitais kapteinis divpadsmitajam mēnesim bija netofatietis Heldajs no Otniela: un viņa kārtā bija divdesmit četri tūkstoši.

27.en: 16Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: the ruler of the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri: of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah:
27.lv:
16

Turklāt pār Israēla ciltīm: rūbeniešu valdnieks bija Eliezers, Zihri dēls: no simeoniešiem Šefatja, Maahas dēls.

27.en: 17Of the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel: of the Aaronites, Zadok:
27.lv: 17 No levītiem Hašabija, Kemuela dēls: no Āroniešiem Cadoks:

27.en: 18Of Judah, Elihu, one of the brethren of David: of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael:
27.lv: 18 No Jūdas Elihu, viens no Dāvida brāļiem: no Isašara Omri, Mihaela dēls:

27.en: 19Of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah: of Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel:
27.lv: 19 No Zebulona Išmaja, Obadjas dēls: no Naftaļa Jerimots, Acriēla dēls:

27.en: 20Of the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah: of the half tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah:
27.lv: 20 No Efraima bērniem Hošeja, Azazijas dēls: no Manases puscilts Joels, Pedajas dēls:

27.en: 21Of the half tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah: of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner:
27.lv: 21 No Manases puscilts Gileādā Ido, Caharijas dēls: no Benjamīna Jaasiēls, Abnera dēls:

27.en: 22Of Dan, Azareel the son of Jeroham. These were the princes of the tribes of Israel.
27.lv: 22 No Dana Azareēls, Jerohama dēls. Šie bija Israēla cilšu prinči.

27.en: 23But David took not the number of them from twenty years old and under: because the LORD had said he would increase Israel like to the stars of the heavens.
27.lv: 23 Bet Dāvids neuzņēma to skaitu no divdesmit gadu vecuma un zemāk: tāpēc ka tas KUNGS bija sacījis, ka viņš vairos Israēlu kā debesu zvaigznes.

27.en: 24Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number, but he finished not, because there fell wrath for it against Israel; neither was the number put in the account of the chronicles of king David.
27.lv: 24 Joābs, Cerujas dēls, iesāka skaitīt, bet viņš nepabeidza, tāpēc ka par to krita bardzība pret Israēlu; nedz tas skaitlis tika likts ķēniņa Dāvida hroniku atskaitē.

27.en: 25And over the king's treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel: and over the storehouses in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the castles, was Jehonathan the son of Uzziah:
27.lv:
25

Un pār ķēniņa dārgumiem bija Azmavets, Adiela dēls: un pār krātuvēm laukos, pilsētās, ciematos un pilīs bija Jeonatans, Ucijas dēls:

27.en: 26And over them that did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub:
27.lv: 26 Un pār tiem, kas darīja lauka darbu zemes apstrādāšanai bija Ezri, Čeluba dēls:

27.en: 27And over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite: over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite:
27.lv: 27 Un pār vīna dārziem bija ramatietis Šimejs: pār vīna dārzu pieaugumu priekš vīna pagrabiem bija šifmietis Zabdi:

27.en: 28And over the olive trees and the sycomore trees that were in the low plains was Baalhanan the Gederite: and over the cellars of oil was Joash:
27.lv: 28 Un pār olīvkokiem un sikomoru kokiem, kas bija zemajos līdzenumos, bija gederietis Baalhanans: un pār eļļas pagrabiem bija Joašs:

27.en: 29And over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:
27.lv: 29 Un pār liellopiem, kas ganījās Šaronā, bija šaronietis Šitrajs: un pār liellopiem, kas bija ielejās, bija Šafats, Adlija dēls:

27.en: 30Over the camels also was Obil the Ishmaelite: and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite:
27.lv: 30 Pār kamieļiem arī bija išmaelietis Obils: un pār ēzeļiem bija meronietis Jehdeja:

27.en: 31And over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagerite. All these were the rulers of the substance which was king David's.
27.lv: 31 Un pār sīklopiem bija hagerietis Jaciss. Visi šie bija valdnieki par iedzīvi, kas bija ķēniņa Dāvida.

27.en: 32Also Jonathan David's uncle was a counsellor, a wise man, and a scribe: and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king's sons:
27.lv: 32 Arī Jonatāns, Dāvida tēvocis, bija padomdevējs, gudrs vīrietis un rakstvedis: un Jehiēes, Hahmoni dēls, bija kopā ar ķēniņa dēliem:

27.en: 33And Ahithophel was the king's counsellor: and Hushai the Archite was the king's companion:
27.lv: 33 Un Ahitofels bija ķēniņa padomdevējs: un arhietis Hušajs bija ķēniņa biedrs:

27.en: 34And after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar: and the general of the king's army was Joab.
27.lv: 34 Un pēc Ahitofela bija Jeojada, Benajas dēls, un Abjatars: un ķēniņa armijas ģenerālis bija Joābs.

28.en: 1And David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the companies that ministered to the king by course, and the captains over the thousands, and captains over the hundreds, and the stewards over all the substance and possession of the king, and of his sons, with the officers, and with the mighty men, and with all the valiant men, unto Jerusalem.
28.lv: 1 Un Dāvids sapulcināja uz Jeruzālemi visus Israēla prinčus, cilšu prinčus un grupu galvenos, kas kalpoja ķēniņam pēc kursiem, un kapteiņus pār tūkstošiem un kapteiņus pār simtiem, un pārziņus pār visu iedzīvi un ķēniņa un viņa dēlu īpašumu kopā ar virsniekiem un varenajiem vīriešiem, un visiem drošsirdīgajiem vīriešiem.

28.en: 2Then David the king stood up upon his feet, and said, Hear me, my brethren, and my people: As for me, I had in mine heart to build an house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and for the footstool of our God, and had made ready for the building:
28.lv: 2 Tad ķēniņš Dāvids nostājās uz savām kājām un sacīja, Klausieties mani, mani brāļi un mani ļaudis: Kas attiecas uz mani, man savā sirdī bija uzbūvēt dusas namu tā KUNGA derības šķirstam un mūsu Dieva kāju pameslam, un [es] biju sagatavojis būvēšanai:

28.en: 3But God said unto me, Thou shalt not build an house for my name, because thou hast been a man of war, and hast shed blood.
28.lv: 3 Bet Dievs man sacīja, Tev nebūs būvēt namu manam vārdam, tāpēc ka tu esi bijis karavīrs un esi izlējis asinis.

28.en: 4Howbeit the LORD God of Israel chose me before all the house of my father to be king over Israel for ever: for he hath chosen Judah to be the ruler; and of the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father he liked me to make me king over all Israel:
28.lv: 4 Taču tas KUNGS, Israēla Dievs, mani izraudzija visa mana tēva nama priekšā par ķēniņu pār Israēlu mūžīgi: jo viņš ir izraudzījis Jūdu būt par valdnieku; un no Jūdas nama, mana tēva namu; un starp mana tēva dēliem viņam patika mani iecelt par ķēniņu pār visu Israēlu:

28.en: 5And of all my sons, (for the LORD hath given me many sons,) he hath chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.
28.lv: 5 Un no visiem maniem dēliem (jo tas KUNGS man ir devis daudz dēlu,) viņš ir izraudzījis manu dēlu Salamanu, sēdēt uz tā KUNGA valstības troņa pār Israēlu.

28.en: 6And he said unto me, Solomon thy son, he shall build my house and my courts: for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
28.lv: 6 Un viņš man sacīja, Tavs dēls Salamans, viņš uzbūvēs manu namu un manus pagalmus: jo es viņu esmu izraudzījis par savu dēlu, un es būšu viņa tēvs.

28.en: 7Moreover I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he be constant to do my commandments and my judgments, as at this day.
28.lv: 7 Turklāt es nostiprināšu viņa valstību mūžīgi, ja viņš būs pastāvīgs darīt manas pavēles un manas tiesas, kā šajā dienā.

28.en: 8Now therefore in the sight of all Israel the congregation of the LORD, and in the audience of our God, keep and seek for all the commandments of the LORD your God: that ye may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance for your children after you for ever.
28.lv: 8 Tāpēc nu visa Israēla, tā KUNGA sanāksmes, skatienā un mūsu Dieva ausīs turiet un meklējiet visas tā KUNGA, sava Dieva, pavēles: lai jūs varat iegūt īpašumā šo labo zemi un to atstātu mantojumā saviem bērniem pēc jums mūžīgi.

28.en: 9And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind: for the LORD searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts: if thou seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off for ever.
28.lv:
9

Un tu, mans dēls Salaman, pazīsti sava tēva Dievu un kalpo viņam ar pilnīgu sirdi un ar labprātīgu prātu: jo tas KUNGS pārmeklē visas sirdis un saprot visas domu iztēles: ja tu viņu meklē, viņš no tevis tiks atrasts; bet, ja tu viņu pamet, viņš tevi atmetīs mūžīgi.

28.en: 10Take heed now; for the LORD hath chosen thee to build an house for the sanctuary: be strong, and do it.
28.lv: 10 Pielūko nu; jo tas KUNGS tevi ir izraudzījis būvēt namu svētnīcai: esi stiprs un dari to.

28.en: 11Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, and of the houses thereof, and of the treasuries thereof, and of the upper chambers thereof, and of the inner parlours thereof, and of the place of the mercy seat,
28.lv: 11 Tad Dāvids deva savam dēlam Salamanam lieveņa un tā namu, tā dārgumu glabātavu, un tā augšējo kambaru, un tā iekšējo atpūtas telpu, un žēlsirdības krēsla vietas paraugu,

28.en: 12And the pattern of all that he had by the spirit, of the courts of the house of the LORD, and of all the chambers round about, of the treasuries of the house of God, and of the treasuries of the dedicated things:
28.lv: 12 Un paraugu par visu, kas viņam bija caur garu, par tā KUNGA nama pagalmiem un visiem kambariem visapkārt, par Dieva dārgumu glabātavām un par veltīto lietu dārgumu glabātavām:

28.en: 13Also for the courses of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of the LORD, and for all the vessels of service in the house of the LORD.
28.lv: 13 Arī par priesteru un levītu kārtām, un par visu tā KUNGA nama kalpošanas darbu un par visiem kalpošanas traukiem tā KUNGA namā.

28.en: 14He gave of gold by weight for things of gold, for all instruments of all manner of service; silver also for all instruments of silver by weight, for all instruments of every kind of service:
28.lv: 14 Viņš deva no zelta pēc svara priekš zelta lietām, par visiem visa veida kalpošanas instrumentiem; arī sudrabu priekš visiem sudraba instrumentiem pēc svara, visiem visa veida kalpošanas instrumentiem:

28.en: 15Even the weight for the candlesticks of gold, and for their lamps of gold, by weight for every candlestick, and for the lamps thereof: and for the candlesticks of silver by weight, both for the candlestick, and also for the lamps thereof, according to the use of every candlestick.
28.lv: 15 Proti, svaru zelta svečturiem un to zelta lukturiem pēc svara ikvienam svečturim un tā lukturiem; un sudraba svečturiem pēc svara, gan svečturim, gan tā lukturiem atbilstoši ikviena svečtura lietošanai.

28.en: 16And by weight he gave gold for the tables of shewbread, for every table; and likewise silver for the tables of silver:
28.lv: 16 Un pēc svara viņš deva zeltu priekšā liekamās maizes galdiem, ikvienam galdam; un tāpat sudrabu sudraba galdiem:

28.en: 17Also pure gold for the fleshhooks, and the bowls, and the cups: and for the golden basons he gave gold by weight for every bason; and likewise silver by weight for every bason of silver:
28.lv: 17 Arī šķīstu zeltu gaļas āķiem un bļodām, un kausiem: un zelta bļodām viņš deva zeltu pēc svara ikvienai bļodai; un tāpat sudrabu pēc svara ikvienai sudraba bļodai:

28.en: 18And for the altar of incense refined gold by weight; and gold for the pattern of the chariot of the cherubims, that spread out their wings, and covered the ark of the covenant of the LORD.
28.lv: 18 Un kvēpināmā altārim rafinētu zeltu pēc svara; un zeltu ķerubu ratu paraugam, kas izpleta savus spārnus un apsedza tā KUNGA derības šķirstu.

28.en: 19All this, said David, the LORD made me understand in writing by his hand upon me, even all the works of this pattern.
28.lv: 19 Visu šo, Dāvids sacīja, tas KUNGS man lika saprast, rakstot ar savu roku pār mani, proti, visus šī parauga darbus.

28.en: 20And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed: for the LORD God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until thou hast finished all the work for the service of the house of the LORD.
28.lv: 20 Un Dāvids savam dēlam Salamanam sacīja, Esi stiprs un drosmīgs un dari to; nebīsties, ne tiec izbiedēts: jo tas KUNGS Dievs, proti, mans Dievs, būs ar tevi; viņš tevi nepievils, ne tevi pametīs, līdz tu būsi pabeidzis visu darbu tā KUNGA nama kalpošanai.

28.en: 21And, behold, the courses of the priests and the Levites, even they shall be with thee for all the service of the house of God: and there shall be with thee for all manner of workmanship every willing skilful man, for any manner of service: also the princes and all the people will be wholly at thy commandment.
28.lv: 21 Un, lūk, priesteru un levītu kārtas, proti, tie būs ar tevi visai Dieva nama kalpošanai: un ar tevi būs visa veida darinājumiem ikviens labprātīgs, prasmīgs vīrietis, jebkura veida kalpošanai: arī prinči un visi ļaudis būs pilnībā pie tavas pavēles.

29.en: 1Furthermore David the king said unto all the congregation, Solomon my son, whom alone God hath chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great: for the palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.
29.lv: 1 Turklāt ķēniņš Dāvids visai sanāksmei sacīja, Mans dēls Salamans, kuru vien Dievs ir izraudzījis, vēl ir jauns un maigs, un darbs ir liels: jo pils nav cilvēkam, bet tam KUNGAM Dievam.

29.en: 2Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for things to be made of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and the brass for things of brass, the iron for things of iron, and wood for things of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, glistering stones, and of divers colours, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
29.lv: 2 Tad nu es ar visu savu spēku esmu sagatavojis sava Dieva namam zeltu, lietām no zelta un sudrabu lietām no sudraba, un misiņu lietām no misiņa, dzelzi lietām no dzelzs, un koku lietām no koka; oniksa akmeņus un akmeņus, ko uzstādīt, mirdzošus akmeņus un dažādās krāsās, un visādus dārgus akmeņus, un marmora akmeņus pārpilnībā.

29.en: 3Moreover, because I have set my affection to the house of my God, I have of mine own proper good, of gold and silver, which I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,
29.lv: 3 Turklāt, tāpēc ka es esmu pieķēries sava Dieva namam, man ir no savām personīgajām mantām, no zelta un sudraba, ko esmu devis sava Dieva namam, pār un pāri visam, ko esmu sagatavojis svētajam namam,

29.en: 4Even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the houses withal:
29.lv: 4 Proti, trīs tūkstoši talentu zelta, no Ofiras zelta, un septiņi tūkstoši talentu rafinēta sudraba, ar ko pārklāt namu sienas:

29.en: 5The gold for things of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by the hands of artificers. And who then is willing to consecrate his service this day unto the LORD?
29.lv: 5 Zelts lietām no zelta un sudrabs lietām no sudraba un visādiem darbiem, kas jātaisa ar amatnieku rokām. Un kurš tad šajā dienā vēlas iesvētīt savu kalpošanu tam KUNGAM?

29.en: 6Then the chief of the fathers and princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers of the king's work, offered willingly,
29.lv: 6 Tad tēvu galvenie un Israēla cilšu prinči, un tūkstošu un simtu kapteiņi kopā ar ķēniņa darba valdniekiem labprātīgi ziedoja,

29.en: 7And gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand drams, and of silver ten thousand talents, and of brass eighteen thousand talents, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
29.lv:
7

Un deva Dieva nama kalpošanai no zelta piecus tūkstošus talentu un desmit tūkstošus drahmu, un no sudraba desmit tūkstošus talentu, un no misiņa astoņpadsmit tūkstošus talentu un simts tūkstošus talentu no dzelzs.

29.en: 8And they with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of the house of the LORD, by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
29.lv: 8 Un tie, pie kuriem tika atrasti dārgi akmeņi, tos deva tā KUNGA nama dārgumiem caur geršonieša Jehiela roku.

29.en: 9Then the people rejoiced, for that they offered willingly, because with perfect heart they offered willingly to the LORD: and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
29.lv: 9 Tad ļaudis priecājās, jo viņi ziedoja labprātīgi, tāpēc ka ar pilnīgu sirdi viņi labprātīgi ziedoja tam KUNGAM: un arī ķēniņš Dāvids priecājās ar lielu prieku.

29.en: 10Wherefore David blessed the LORD before all the congregation: and David said, Blessed be thou, LORD God of Israel our father, for ever and ever.
29.lv: 10 Tādēļ Dāvids svētīja to KUNGU visas sanāksmes priekšā: un Dāvids sacīja, Svētīts lai esi, tu Kungs, mūsu tēva Israēla Dievs, mūžīgi mūžam.

29.en: 11Thine, O LORD, is the greatness, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty: for all that is in the heaven and in the earth is thine; thine is the kingdom, O LORD, and thou art exalted as head above all.
29.lv: 11 Tavs, ak KUNGS, ir diženums un spēks, un godība, un uzvara, un majestātiskums; jo viss, kas ir debesī un zemē, ir tavs; tava ir valstība, ak KUNGS, un tu esi paaugstināts kā galva pāri visam.

29.en: 12Both riches and honour come of thee, and thou reignest over all; and in thine hand is power and might; and in thine hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all.
29.lv: 12 No tevis nāk gan bagātība, gan gods, un tu valdi pār visu; un tavā rokā ir spēks un varenība; un tavā rokā ir darīt lielu un dot stiprumu visiem.

29.en: 13Now therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy glorious name.
29.lv: 13 Tāpēc nu, mūsu Dievs, mēs pasakāmies tev un slavējam tavu krāšņo vārdu.

29.en: 14But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things come of thee, and of thine own have we given thee.
29.lv: 14 Bet kas es esmu un kas ir mani ļaudis, ka mēs tik labprātīgi spētu ziedot pēc šāda veida? jo viss nāk no tevis, un mēs tev esam devuši no tava paša.

29.en: 15For we are strangers before thee, and sojourners, as were all our fathers: our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is none abiding.
29.lv: 15 Jo mēs esam svešinieki tavā priekšā un piedzīvotāji, kā visi mūsu tēvi: mūsu dienas uz zemes ir kā ēna, un nav neviena paliekoša.

29.en: 16O LORD our God, all this store that we have prepared to build thee an house for thine holy name cometh of thine hand, and is all thine own.
29.lv: 16 Ak, KUNGS, mūsu Dievs, viss šis krājums, ko mēs esam sagatavojuši tev uzbūvēt namu tavam svētajam vārdam, nāk no tavas rokas un viss ir tevis paša.

29.en: 17I know also, my God, that thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people, which are present here, to offer willingly unto thee.
29.lv: 17 Es arī zinu, mans Dievs, ka tu pārbaudi sirdi, un [tev] ir patika taisnīgumā. Kas attiecas uz mani, savas sirds taisnīgumā es šo visu esmu labprāt ziedojis: un nu, es ar prieku esmu redzējis tavus ļaudis, kas ir šeit klāt, labprātīgi tev ziedot.

29.en: 18O LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this for ever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of thy people, and prepare their heart unto thee:
29.lv: 18 Ak KUNGS, Ābrahāma, Īzāka un Israēla, mūsu tēvu, Dievs, turi šo mūžīgi savu ļaužu sirds domu iztēlē un sagatavo viņu sirdis sev:

29.en: 19And give unto Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep thy commandments, thy testimonies, and thy statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for the which I have made provision.
29.lv: 19 Un dod manam dēlam Salamanam pilnīgu sirdi turēt tavas pavēles, tavas liecības un tavus statūtus un darīt visas šīs lietas, un būvēt pili, kurai es esmu sagatavojis.

29.en: 20And David said to all the congregation, Now bless the LORD your God. And all the congregation blessed the LORD God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads, and worshipped the LORD, and the king.
29.lv:
20

Un Dāvids visai sanāksmei sacīja, Tad nu svētījiet to KUNGU, savu Dievu. Un visa sanāksme svētīja to KUNGU, savu tēvu Dievu, un nolieca savas galvas, un godināja to KUNGU un ķēniņu.

29.en: 21And they sacrificed sacrifices unto the LORD, and offered burnt offerings unto the LORD, on the morrow after that day, even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel:
29.lv: 21 Un viņi upurēja tam KUNGAM upurus un ziedoja tam KUNGAM dedzināmos ziedojumus nākamajā dienā pēc tās dienas, proti, tūkstoš bullēnu, tūkstoš aunu un tūkstoš jēru ar viņu dzeramajiem ziedojumiem un upurus pārpilnībā par visu Israēlu:

29.en: 22And did eat and drink before the LORD on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him unto the LORD to be the chief governor, and Zadok to be priest.
29.lv: 22 Un tajā dienā ēda un dzēra tā KUNGA priekšā ar lielu līksmību. Un Salamanu, Dāvida dēlu, viņi iecēla otrreiz par ķēniņu un svaidīja viņu tam KUNGAM par galveno pārvaldnieku, un Cadoku par priesteri.

29.en: 23Then Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
29.lv: 23 Tad Salamans sēdēja uz tā KUNGA troņa kā ķēniņš sava tēva Dāvida vietā, un sekmējās; un viss Israēls viņam paklausīja.

29.en: 24And all the princes, and the mighty men, and all the sons likewise of king David, submitted themselves unto Solomon the king.
29.lv: 24 Un visi prinči un varenie, un visi ķēniņa Dāvida dēli tāpat pakļāvās ķēniņam Salamanam.

29.en: 25And the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
29.lv: 25 Un tas KUNGS ārkārtīgi paaugstināja Salamanu visa Israēla skatienā un viņam piešķīra tādu karalisku majestātiskumu, kāds nav bijis nevienam ķēniņam pirms viņa Israēlā.

29.en: 26Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
29.lv:
26

Tā Dāvids, Jessija dēls, valdīja pār visu Israēlu.

29.en: 27And the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
29.lv: 27 Un laiks, kad viņš valdīja pār Israēlu, bija četrdesmit gadi; septiņus gadus viņš valdīja Hebronā un trīsdesmit trīs gadus viņš valdīja Jeruzālemē.

29.en: 28And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour: and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
29.lv: 28 Un viņš nomira labā vecumā, pilns dienu, bagātības un goda: un viņa dēls Salamans valdīja viņa vietā.

29.en: 29Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Samuel the seer, and in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,
29.lv: 29 Tad nu ķēniņa Dāvida darbi, pirmie un pēdējie, lūk, tie ir rakstīti gaišreģa Samuēla grāmatā un pravieša Nātana grāmatā, un gaišreģa Gada grāmatā,

29.en: 30With all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the countries.
29.lv: 30 Ar visu viņa valdīšanu un viņa varenību, un laikiem, kas gāja pār viņu un pār Israēlu, un pār visām zemju valstībām.
